bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 126 (Thursday, July 28, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CROW:H.R. 8560.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Will to Fight Act of 2022Article 1, Section 8 of the Constitution gives Congress thepower to make laws that are necessary and proper to carry outits enumerated powers.[Page H7406]

item.title: Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 392.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

summary.text:
Will to Fight Act of 2022

This bill requires the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to submit a report to Congress examining the extent to which analyses of the military will to fight and the national will to fight informed broader analyses of the intelligence community. The bill specifies that the report consider analyses of how the armed forces and governments of Ukraine, Afghanistan, and Iraq would perform at key junctures.

bill.title: Will to Fight Act of 2022

item.title: To direct the Director of National Intelligence to submit to Congress a report relating to analyses of the military will to fight and the national will to fight with respect to the Governments of Ukraine, Afghanistan, and Iraq, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
